incident_updates.body: From 06:00–06:35 UTC, we saw Stripe.com failing to load for some users. This is now resolved.
As of 06:35 UTC, Stripe.com was failing to load for some users but has since recovered. We are continuing to validate that this issue is fully resolved, and we are working to prevent its recurrence.

incidents.name: Potential delays with some Euro payouts

incident_updates.body:
From 10:50 to 19:00 UTC on February 27, 2025, an external technical issue resulted in partial delays for both inbound and outbound transfers via Target 2 EUR wires. This issue is now resolved.

We will continue monitoring and provide any further updates, if necessary.

Since February 27, 2025, an external technical issue may cause a partial settlement delay for both inbound and outbound transfers via Target 2 EUR wires. Affected payouts and inbound bank transfers may be delayed, with the timeframe still unknown. The delay timeframe is unknown as the issue is ongoing. Our engineering and partnership teams are working with our banking partners. We will share updates as soon as more details are available.

incidents.name: Delays with GBP Debits, UK Bank Transfers and Top Ups

incident_updates.body: The issues with GBP Debits payment processing, Top Ups, and UK Bank Transfers are now resolved.

GBP Debits payment processing, UK Bank Transfers, and Top Ups are recovering. We are working closely with our banking partner to ensure that the issue is resolved as quickly as possible. No action is required on your part.

We are experiencing delays in GBP Debits payment processing, UK Bank Transfers and Top Ups as a result of a banking partner outage. We are working closely with them to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. No action is required on your part.

components.name: Acquirers and payment methods
components.description: Banks, card networks, and local payments

incident_updates.body: From 02:44-03:57 UTC, we saw an elevated rate of errors for Apple Pay payments due to an external issue. This is now resolved.
We are currently monitoring an elevated errors on Apple Pay payments. This is likely impacting a number of payment processors.
From 00:21–04:10 UTC, chat support for Link was unavailable. Requests to our other support channels were unaffected. This is now resolved.
As of 00:21 UTC, the chat support channel is unavailable. Requests to our other support channels are unaffected. We’ll post an update soon.

incidents.name: Euro payouts scheduled for November 29th are delayed

incident_updates.body: We have been working with our banking partner through the weekend to minimize payout delays for European users. We have confirmed that Euro payouts have been processed as of 10:30 UTC Monday, December 2nd. We expect all impacted payouts due on Friday, November 29th to become available in merchant bank accounts today.

We are investigating a delay for manual and automatic Euro payouts with a scheduled arrival date of Friday, November 29th. This delay is due to a technical issue with one of our banking partners and we are working closely with them to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. No action is required on your part. Future payouts remain unaffected by this issue.

incidents.name: Service Disruption for Issuers and Acquirers in Italy

incident_updates.body: Between 10:24 UTC on November 28th and 17:10 UTC on November 29th, we saw service disruptions for Issuers and Acquirers in Italy.  This issue was caused by damage to the physical infrastructure used to provide internet service to Italy.  All repairs have been completed and transactions are now processing as expected.  This issue is considered resolved although we will continue to monitor.
We are continuing to monitor and will post updates as they become available. There are no issues with Stripe systems at this time.

As of 10:24 UTC on November 28th, we have seen service disruption to Issuers and Acquirers in Italy. Stripe remains operational. The issue seems to be impacting multiple banks in the region. We are continuing to monitor and will post further updates as they become available.

incident_updates.body: We've resolved the issue with the inconsistent Dashboard chart data and re-enabled the previously impacted charts.

Some Dashboard charts are displaying inconsistent data across different sections. We've disabled the impacted charts. Our engineers are actively investigating the issue, and we will provide an update once more information is available.

incidents.name: Delayed reconciliation of Great British Pounds (GBP) top-ups

incident_updates.body: Balance top ups of Great British Pounds (GBP) were delayed . The issue has been resolved, and all top ups scheduled to arrive before 17:00 UTC on October 21st have successfully completed. We apologize for the inconvenience this issue has caused.
We're currently investigating an issue delaying reconciliation of Great British Pounds (GBP) top-ups to Refunds and Disputes, Connect and Issuing balances.

incidents.name: Dashboard Reporting inaccessible for some merchants

incident_updates.body: From 18:40–20:57 UTC, Dashboard Reporting was inaccessible for some users. This is now resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We’re currently seeing an issue resulting in Dashboard Reporting being inaccessible for some users beginning at 18:40 UTC. We’ve identified the cause, and are working on a fix.

incidents.name: API failures from Dashboard for subscriptions and retrieving invoices

incident_updates.body: Between 18:26 and 19:38 UTC UTC, we saw issues with making API calls to Stripe.  This primarily affected the retrieval of invoice, subscription, and customer methods.  Customers would notice a 4xx error code of anonymous_endpoint_with_api_key when trying to make these API requests. This is now resolved.
As of 19:38 UTC, issues with making API calls to Stripe has been remediated . We’re continuing to validate that this issue is fully resolved and will provide a final confirmation shortly.

We’re currently seeing API errors from the Stripe Dashboard which are impacting the retrieval of invoices and subscriptions. We’ve identified the cause, and are working on a fix.  We will provide an update once more information is available.

Starting at approximately 18:35 UTC we noticed API errors from the Stripe Dashboard.  This is currently impacting the ability to retrieve invoices and subscriptions.  Our engineers are actively investigating the issue, and we will provide an update once more information is available.

incidents.name: Browser compatibility issues affecting Stripe dashboard access on iOS, iPadOS, and macOS

incident_updates.body:
From October 3rd, 19:33 UTC to October 7th, 08:43 UTC, users accessing the Stripe dashboard via iOS and iPadOS browsers (versions earlier than 16.4) or Safari on macOS (versions earlier than 16.4) may have encountered issues. The problem has since been resolved. For more information on supported browsers [0]
[0] https://docs.stripe.com/dashboard/basics#browser-compatibility

We’re currently seeing elevated errors on BLIK payments. We’ve identified the cause, and are working on a fix.
Our engineers are continuing to investigate elevated errors on BLIK payments. We’ll post another update soon.
We’re currently investigating elevated errors on BLIK payments. We’ll post an update soon.

incident_updates.body: From 03:30–06:21 UTC, we saw issues responding to support requests via phone call and chat. Requests to our other support channels were unaffected. This is now resolved.
We’re currently investigating issues responding to support requests via phone call and chat. Requests to our other support channels are unaffected. We’ll post an update soon.

Some payouts scheduled from Stripe to United Kingdom bank accounts on September 23 between 10:00 UTC and 11:00 UTC failed. The issue has been resolved, and payouts scheduled to arrive after 11:00 UTC on September 23 have successfully completed. All customers impacted by this incident have been notified directly.

Some GBP payouts scheduled to arrive on 2024-09-23 have been incorrectly marked as failed. Our engineers are actively investigating the issue, and we will provide an update once more information is available.

As of 16:30 UTC, Stripe has not observed any further network disruptions since the last update and can confirm that the issue has been resolved. We will continue working with our provider to prevent similar incidents in the future.
We continue to actively monitor the situation. No new network disruptions have been detected. We will provide further updates once we confirm that the issue is fully resolved.

Between 05:10 - 05:20 UTC, 05:25 - 05:27 UTC and 06:58 - 07:02 UTC, Stripe continued to experience minor network disruptions resulting in some users experiencing elevated error rates and response times with requests to the Stripe API. There was no impact to Stripe systems or applications. We believe that this is now mitigated. We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Between 03:16 and 03:22 UTC , Stripe experienced a network disruption which resulted in elevated error rates and response times with requests to the Stripe API. Although there was no impact to Stripe systems or applications, users would have experienced errors when trying to make API calls during this impact time. We believe that this is now mitigated, though we will continue to monitor.

incident_updates.body: Between 12:59 to 16:01 UTC on August 12th, we saw elevated card authorization errors related to an issuing bank in the US which impacted some Visa transactions. Card authorization errors have subsided and there are no current disruptions to Visa transactions. Throughout this period, Stripe's systems remained healthy.  Visa has also confirmed resolution.

Between 12:59 to 16:01 UTC on August 12th, we saw elevated card authorization errors related to an issuing bank in the US which impacted some Visa transactions. Card authorization errors have subsided and there are no current disruptions to Visa transactions. Throughout this period, Stripe's systems remained healthy.  We are continuing to monitor all transactions until a resolution notice is received from the provider.

We are still seeing elevated card authorization errors related to an issuing bank in the US which is impacting some Visa transactions. There are still no issues with Stripe systems at this time. We're continuing to monitor and will post an update as soon as the issue is resolved.

As of 13:00 UTC, we've seen elevated card authorization errors related to an issuing bank in the US which is impacting some Visa transactions. There are no issues with Stripe systems at this time. We're continuing to investigate and will post further updates

incidents.name: Global IT incident affecting inflow of emails

incident_updates.body: The global IT incident impacting email communications since July 19 has been resolved. Stripe's services remained operational throughout. All support channels, including email, are operating as normal.

Stripe is aware of the global IT incident starting on July 19th. Our services remain available and operational. Some users report difficulty reaching our email support channel. This issue is not caused by Stripe’s systems. Our email, phone, and chat support remain accessible.

incidents.name: Some EMEA and APAC payouts landing later than usual

incident_updates.body: On June 24, we determined that a subset of merchants in the EU and Singapore will receive payouts later than expected. For payouts anticipated to arrive on June 24th, we expect that these payouts will land by June 25 in the EU, and by June 26 in Singapore. A fix has been rolled out, and we are back to business as usual for payouts since 17:00 UTC.
EMEA and APAC currencies payouts scheduled for 2024-06-24 are landing later than usual. We’ve identified the cause, and are continuing to work on a fix.
EMEA and APAC currencies payouts scheduled for 2024-06-24 are landing later than usual. We’ve identified the cause, and are working on a fix

We are currently aware of an issue causing some terminal devices to appear offline. We have identified the cause, and are working on a fix.

incidents.name: Elevated declines on JPMorgan Chase-issued cards

incident_updates.body: From 19:38–22:17 UTC, Stripe saw elevated latency and declines on transactions involving credit cards issued by JPMorgan Chase, as a result of a problem affecting the issuing bank and external to Stripe. This issue is now resolved.

From 19:38–22:17 UTC, Stripe saw elevated latency and declines on transactions involving credit cards issued by JPMorgan Chase, as a result of a problem affecting the issuing bank and external to Stripe. Latency and authorization rates have now returned to normal, and we are continuing to monitor.

We are continuing to monitor an issue resulting in elevated latency and declines on transactions involving credit cards issued by JPMorgan Chase, as a result of an issue affecting the bank and external to Stripe. We are actively engaged with our partners to ensure this is resolved as quickly as possible. We will post further updates here.
